column4: KorN[CM] : okay, you seem to have the latest kernel module (version 9755), which should go with nvidia-glx-new. Maybe the older nvidia-glx package is interfering. Try 'sudo apt-get remove nvidia-glx' and say yes if it asks.
KorN[CM] : 'sudo apt-get --reinstall install nvidia-glx-new'
KorN[CM] : time to try and restart X: sudo invoke-rc.d gdm start
KorN[CM] : no 'sudo invoke-rc.d gdm start'
KorN[CM] : is that all that happens?
KorN[CM] : that's what that does.
KorN[CM] : Hit Ctrl-Alt-F7 and tell me what happens
done, nothing
it is now removed (we have removed it before)
now whats next?
it is done
is the full command "restart x: sudo invoke-rc.d gdm start"?
starting gnome display manager.... OK
yeah thats it
dont we need to start x??
nothing happens, just back at the command line
when i typed in start x it worked
trying to change screen res now to 1024X7668
thanks you!
no more changes from my end tob e made :)
thanks so much!
